headline: Mars to invest €1bn in Europe as Kellanova deal remains unresolved
summary: The American confectionery giant said that the investment will go towards modernising manufacturing, with factories in France, Poland and Lithuania among those set to benefit.View on euronews

headline: EU review of Mars-Kellanova deal restarts as December deadline set
summary: The resumption of proceedings suggests the missing information to sign off the deal has now been received.

raw.headline: EU review of Mars-Kellanova deal restarts as December deadline set
raw.summary: The resumption of proceedings suggests the missing information to sign off the deal has now been received.

headline: Is Kellanova Stock Underperforming the Nasdaq?
summary: Kellanova has lagged the Nasdaq Composite over the past year, and analysts maintain a cautious outlook on the stock’s future performance.

raw.headline: Is Kellanova Stock Underperforming the Nasdaq?
raw.summary: Kellanova has lagged the Nasdaq Composite over the past year, and analysts maintain a cautious outlook on the stock’s future performance.

headline: Candy maker Mars plans $1.2 billion investment to boost EU operations
summary: The new investment builds on more than 1.5 billion euros that the candy maker has already poured into EU manufacturing over the past five years.  Mars operates 24 factories across 10 EU countries, employing 25,000 people.  Last year, Mars announced a $36 billion deal to acquire Pringles maker Kellanova.
